pages.text: Certain mixtures of dirt and gravel produce a soil suitable for more uncommon plants, unable to grow on farmland.$(br2)The soil can be attuned to one of the four elements to add additional effects.$(br2)$(info) Elemental plants will grow on any type of elemental soil, including the base type.

Obtained by throwing a block of elemental soil into lava, this fiery soil will cause some of its harvested drops to be cooked if appropriate.$(br2)In addition, each plant that is harvested from this soil may drop experience.

Obtained by throwing a block of elemental soil into water and allowing it to soak, this soil will cause any crop that grows upon it to be automatically harvested.$(br2)$(info)If a container is below, the drops will be placed there or otherwise on the surface. If gravel is below, this behaviour is suppressed.

Obtained by throwing a block of elemental soil on the ground above the defined height ($(info) a default of 90 blocks or higher) and allowing them to soak in the energy.$(br2)Plants grown on this soil will grow much faster than normal.

Obtained by throwing a block of elemental soil down beneath the ground, below the defined height ($(info) a default of 30 blocks or lower), and allowing it to soak in the energy.$(br2)The yield of any crop grown upon this soil will be increased.
